intro: Dampiera rotundifolia, commonly known as the round-leaved dampiera, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its succulent, rounded leaves and showy blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rock crevices and woodland areas. Its leaves are thick and fleshy, adapted to retain water in its native habitat. Dampiera rotundifolia is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
